intro: Pelargonium andrewsii, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow-orange flowers and hairy, aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and resilience. Pelargonium andrewsii is also valued for its use in traditional medicine.
